intro: Micropholis suborbicularis, commonly known as the orbicular micropholis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its small, orbicular-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
